verses.verse: Then came<WH935> all<WH3605> the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478> to<WH413> David<WH1732> unto Hebron,<WH2275> and spoke,<WH559> saying,<WH559> Behold,<WH2009> we<WH587> are thy bone<WH6106> and thy flesh.<WH1320>

Also <WH1571> in time past,<WH865> <WH8032> when Saul<WH7586> was<WH1961> king<WH4428> over<WH5921> us, thou<WH859> wast<WH1961> he that leddest out<WH3318> and broughtest<WH935> <WH853> in Israel:<WH3478> and the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> to thee Thou<WH859> shalt feed<WH7462> <WH853> my people<WH5971> <WH853> Israel,<WH3478> and thou<WH859> shalt be<WH1961> a captain<WH5057> over<WH5921> Israel.<WH3478>

So all<WH3605> the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478> came<WH935> to<WH413> the king<WH4428> to Hebron;<WH2275> and king<WH4428> David<WH1732> made<WH3772> a league<WH1285> with them in Hebron<WH2275> before<WH6440> the LORD:<WH3068> and they anointed<WH4886> <WH853> David<WH1732> king<WH4428> over<WH5921> Israel.<WH3478>
David <WH1732> was thirty<WH7970> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he began to reign,<WH4427> and he reigned<WH4427> forty<WH705> years.<WH8141>

In Hebron<WH2275> he reigned<WH4427> over<WH5921> Judah<WH3063> seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> and six<WH8337> months:<WH2320> and in Jerusalem<WH3389> he reigned<WH4427> thirty<WH7970> and three<WH7969> years<WH8141> over<WH5921> all<WH3605> Israel<WH3478> and Judah.<WH3063>

And the king<WH4428> and his men<WH376> went<WH1980> to Jerusalem<WH3389> unto<WH413> the Jebusites,<WH2983> the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land:<WH776> which spoke<WH559> unto David,<WH1732> saying,<WH559> Except<WH3588> <WH518> thou take away<WH5493> the blind<WH5787> and the lame,<WH6455> thou shalt not<WH3808> come in<WH935> hither:<WH2008> thinking,<WH559> David<WH1732> cannot<WH3808> come in<WH935> hither.<WH2008>
Nevertheless David<WH1732> took<WH3920> <WH853> the stronghold<WH4686> of Zion:<WH6726> the same<WH1931> is the city<WH5892> of David.<WH1732>

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> on that<WH1931> day,<WH3117> Whosoever<WH3605> getteth up<WH5060> to the gutter,<WH6794> and smiteth<WH5221> the Jebusites,<WH2983> and the lame<WH6455> and the blind,<WH5787> that are hated<WH8130> of David's<WH1732> soul,<WH5315> he shall be chief and captain. Wherefore<WH5921> <WH3651> they said,<WH559> The blind<WH5787> and the lame<WH6455> shall not<WH3808> come<WH935> into<WH413> the house.<WH1004>

So David<WH1732> dwelt<WH3427> in the fort,<WH4686> and called<WH7121> it the city<WH5892> of David.<WH1732> And David<WH1732> built<WH1129> round about<WH5439> from<WH4480> Millo<WH4407> and inward.<WH1004>
And David<WH1732> went on,<WH1980> <WH1980> and grew great,<WH1419> and the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of hosts<WH6635> was with<WH5973> him.

And Hiram<WH2438> king<WH4428> of Tyre<WH6865> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to<WH413> David,<WH1732> and cedar<WH730> trees,<WH6086> and carpenters,<WH2796> <WH6086> and masons:<WH2796> <WH18> <WH7023> and they built<WH1129> David<WH1732> a house.<WH1004>

And David<WH1732> perceived<WH3045> that<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> had established<WH3559> him king<WH4428> over<WH5921> Israel,<WH3478> and that<WH3588> he had exalted<WH5375> his kingdom<WH4467> for his people<WH5971> Israel's<WH3478> sake.<WH5668>

And David<WH1732> took<WH3947> him more<WH5750> concubines<WH6370> and wives<WH802> out of Jerusalem,<WH4480> <WH3389> after<WH310> he was come<WH935> from Hebron:<WH4480> <WH2275> and there were yet<WH5750> sons<WH1121> and daughters<WH1323> born<WH3205> to David.<WH1732>
And these<WH428> be the names<WH8034> of those that were born<WH3209> unto him in Jerusalem;<WH3389> Shammua,<WH8051> and Shobab,<WH7727> and Nathan,<WH5416> and Solomon,<WH8010>
Ibhar <WH2984> also, and Elishua,<WH474> and Nepheg,<WH5298> and Japhia,<WH3309>
And Elishama,<WH476> and Eliada,<WH450> and Eliphalet.<WH467>

But when the Philistines<WH6430> heard<WH8085> that<WH3588> they had anointed<WH4886> <WH853> David<WH1732> king<WH4428> over<WH5921> Israel,<WH3478> all<WH3605> the Philistines<WH6430> came up<WH5927> to seek<WH1245> <WH853> David;<WH1732> and David<WH1732> heard<WH8085> of it, and went down<WH3381> to<WH413> the hold.<WH4686>
The Philistines<WH6430> also came<WH935> and spread themselves<WH5203> in the valley<WH6010> of Rephaim.<WH7497>

And David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> of the LORD,<WH3068> saying,<WH559> Shall I go up<WH5927> to<WH413> the Philistines?<WH6430> wilt thou deliver<WH5414> them into mine hand?<WH3027> And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto<WH413> David,<WH1732> Go up:<WH5927> for<WH3588> I will doubtless deliver<WH5414> <WH5414> <WH853> the Philistines<WH6430> into thine hand.<WH3027>

And David<WH1732> came<WH935> to Baal-perazim,<WH1188> and David<WH1732> smote<WH5221> them there,<WH8033> and said,<WH559> The LORD<WH3068> hath broken forth upon<WH6555> <WH853> mine enemies<WH341> before<WH6440> me, as the breach<WH6556> of waters.<WH4325> Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of that<WH1931> place<WH4725> Baal-perazim.<WH1188>
And there<WH8033> they left<WH5800> <WH853> their images,<WH6091> and David<WH1732> and his men<WH376> burned<WH5375> them.
And the Philistines<WH6430> came up<WH5927> yet<WH5750> again,<WH3254> and spread themselves<WH5203> in the valley<WH6010> of Rephaim.<WH7497>

And when David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> of the LORD,<WH3068> he said,<WH559> Thou shalt not<WH3808> go up;<WH5927> but fetch a compass<WH5437> <WH413> behind<WH310> them, and come<WH935> upon them over against<WH4480> <WH4136> the mulberry trees.<WH1057>

And let it be,<WH1961> when thou hearest<WH8085> <WH853> the sound<WH6963> of a going<WH6807> in the tops<WH7218> of the mulberry trees,<WH1057> that then<WH227> thou shalt bestir<WH2782> thyself: for<WH3588> then<WH227> shall the LORD<WH3068> go out<WH3318> before<WH6440> thee, to smite<WH5221> the host<WH4264> of the Philistines.<WH6430>

And David<WH1732> did<WH6213> so,<WH3651> as<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> had commanded<WH6680> him; and smote<WH5221> <WH853> the Philistines<WH6430> from Geba<WH4480> <WH1387> until thou come<WH935> to Gazer.<WH1507>
